content: cozy cabled pumpkins materials bulky/chunky/worsted weight yarn whichever size needed to knit tightly size 5 dpns darning needle or embroidery needle for weaving in ends poly fill instructions co 20 stitches with main color and distribute evenly across dpns join being careful not to twist stitches round 1 *k1 m1 p1* around 30sts round 2 *k2 m1 p1* around 40sts round 3 *k3 m1 p1* around 50sts round 4 *k4 p1* around round 5 *c4f p1 k4 p1* around round 6-9 *k4 p1* around large pumpkin repeat rounds 5-9 five 5 more times for a total of 6 repeats then follow steps below medium pumpkin repeat rounds 5-9 four 4 more times for a total of 5 repeats then follow steps below small pumpkin repeat rounds 5-9 two 2 more times for a total of 3 repeats then follow steps below decrease & stem round 1 *k2tog k2 p1* around 40sts round 2 *k2tog k1 p1* around 30sts round 3 *k2tog p1* around 20sts round 4 *k2tog* around 10sts round 5 switch to stem color then k2tog around 5sts knit icord until stem reaches desired length cut yarn leaving long tail pull tail through center of icord and weave in pulling tight to create a bend in the stem finishing cut main color yarn leaving a tail at least 12 inches long weave in to choose gap at top of stem if one is present at the color change and then pull yarn through opposite side of stem so the yarn pulls equally from two sides when tugged and down through the pumpkin so it s hanging out the open bottom end keep yarn in center as you stuff poly fill into the pumpkin keep stuffing in a donut shape to ensure your pumpkin dimples at top and bottom later when stuffed to your liking use same yarn in center to weave the bottom shut and make sure to pull extremely tightly so that the pumpkin dimples on both ends tie a knot to make sure the gauge stays and use darning needle to each end of the yarn through widest point of pumpkin sides and trim so no ends are left sticking out
